thread.title: S & T Bancorp (STBA) Set to Announce Quarterly Earnings on Tuesday
thread.title_full: S & T Bancorp (STBA) Set to Announce Quarterly Earnings on Tuesday

title: S & T Bancorp (STBA) Set to Announce Quarterly Earnings on Tuesday
text:
Tweet 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) is scheduled to be announcing its Q315 earnings results on Tuesday, October 20th. Analysts expect the company to announce earnings of $0.55 per share and revenue of $62.72 million for the quarter. 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) last released its quarterly earnings results on Tuesday, July 21st. The financial services provider reported $0.52 EPS for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.48 by $0.04. The company had revenue of $62.20 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $59 million. During the same quarter last year, the firm posted $0.49 earnings per share. On average, analysts expect S & T Bancorp to post $2.07 EPS for the current fiscal year and $2.30 EPS for the next fiscal year. 
Shares of S & T Bancorp ( NASDAQ:STBA ) opened at 32.66 on Friday. The firm’s 50 day moving average is $31.35 and its 200-day moving average is $29.57. S & T Bancorp has a 52-week low of $24.24 and a 52-week high of $33.14. The company has a market capitalization of $1.14 billion and a P/E ratio of 17.06. 
Several equities research analysts recently weighed in on STBA shares. RBC Capital raised their price target on shares of S & T Bancorp from $29.00 to $32.00 and gave the stock a “sector perform” rating in a research note on Wednesday, July 22nd. Piper Jaffray cut shares of S & T Bancorp from an “overweight” rating to a “neutral” rating and lifted their target price for the company from $30.00 to $32.00 in a research note on Wednesday, July 22nd. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Keefe, Bruyette & Woods raised their price target on shares of S & T Bancorp from $31.00 to $33.00 and gave the company an “outperform” rating in a report on Wednesday, July 22nd. Finally, Zacks raised shares of S & T Bancorp from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $37.00 target price for the company in a report on Wednesday, July 22nd. Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and one has issued a buy rating to the company’s stock. The company currently has an average rating of “Hold” and an average target price of $32.00. 
In other news, Director James Thomas Gibson sold 75,000 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction dated Thursday, July 23rd. The shares were sold at an average price of $32.54, for a total transaction of $2,440,500.00. The transaction was disclosed in a document filed with the SEC, which can be accessed through this link . Also, Director Jerry Delmar Hostetter sold 5,500 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction dated Thursday, September 17th. The stock was sold at an average price of $31.95, for a total transaction of $175,725.00. Following the transaction, the director now owns 15,003 shares in the company, valued at $479,345.85. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. ( NASDAQ:STBA ) is a bank holding company. The Company operates through its fully owned subsidiary companies, including   S&T operates   which offers services, which contain   deposits,   supplying   services; Wealth Management, which offers   titles, protector and custodian of employee benefits and other trust and brokerage services, as well as a registered investment advisor that manages private investment accounts for individuals and associations, and Insurance, contains an insurance agency offering commercial property and casualty insurance, group life and health coverage, employee benefit solutions and personal insurance lines. S&T possesses a one half interest.
